intro: Pedicularis longicaulis, commonly known as the long-stemmed lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stem and clusters of small, pink or purple flowers. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Pedicularis longicaulis is typically found in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained, nutrient-poor soils.
